data.title: From Cattle to Crypto: How a Handful of Wyoming Officials Quietly Built a Global Stablecoin
data.description: In August, Wyoming officially launched a stablecoin, called FRNT, for Frontier, the first of its kind. The state famous for cowboys has jumped into crypto Wyoming has launched FRNT, the first U.S. state-issued stablecoin, under the control of a small circle of public officials with sweeping influence. While touted as a tool for global financial inclusion, critics warn the project blends startup ambition with unchecked government power and limited public accountability.
data.author: Tim Tolka
